Reviews.Title: “Go to Hotel La Residence Voyageur instead!”
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: Go to Hotel La Residence Voyageur instead - a world of difference for just a few extra dollars per night - amazing service and very clean dwelling. Unsanitary and poor value; Terrible management: I have stayed at Hotel Eureka 3 times in the past because of it's low price, with mixed feelings. But, after my most recent trip to Montreal I will NEVER stay there again. I arrived at night and asked for a room for two people. I was charged $70 for one night plus a $5 key deposit and was directed to a room on the third floor that ended up having a single bed - NOT a two-person room. I asked to change rooms and was then offered a room with a queen-size bed. The bed, sheets, and room were filthy. I asked the desk person to change the bed sheets and they only provided another sheet for us to change ourselves, which wasn't even the correct size. After being sold a room for a two people, and being provided a 1-person room, and then being offered an unprepared room and asked to change the bed sheets myself, I decided not to stay and asked for my money back. The desk person refused to provide a refund saying that it was against the hotel's policy. They had written by hand "No re-imbursements" on a receipt that was not provided to us at the time of purchase, and claimed that they did everything within reason to satisfy us. After some time arguing, we left this disgusting hotel and lost the money we paid. We ended up staying at Hotel La Residence Voyageur, which was $80 per night for a clean, two-bed large room with ensuite full bathroom and small breakfast included. I will always go back to Hotel La Residence Voyageur for the value and service. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “the worst ever”
Reviews.Author: lee g
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst dump I've ever stayed in, and that includes hotels and hostels in dozens of countries on five continents. Even a $2 per night hostel in Malaysia was better. Much better. I paid for a week and left after three days, don't know how I lasted that long. The heater worked the first night (in January) but not the next two nights, workmen directly across from my door until late at night, nobody on duty to complain to. Entrance reeks of orange air "freshener" - what smell are they trying to cover up? Lots of drunk and stoned guys and strange noises. Didn't get my money back of course. Tried filing a complaint with the BBB, Montreal Tourism, Small Hotels Association, and others - nobody will help. Even sent an e-mail to several homeless shelters, offering them the room for the remainder of the week - no takers. And you have to give this place a minimum of one star (circle) or you get an error message. This place doesn't even deserve that.

Reviews.Title: “The other reviews are accurate...”
Reviews.Author: LaraM_15
Reviews.Content: I booked this "hotel" at the last minute for New Year's weekend. I was aware that it didn't get the best reviews, but I was cautiously optimistic. Anyway, it did meet my expectations. The only positive thing I can say about Hotel Eureka is the location: it is close to the bus stop, to metro stops, Gay Village /St. Catherine St (2 blocks away). I did see a lot of homeless in the area, but I felt perfectly safe. When I arrived a the "hotel," they made me pay in cash at check-in which I thought was very unprincipled (and wrote on Booking.com that they should include that information as well a quote the entire â€œhotel priceâ€� with tax included). I made them show me the room which was not â€œmade up,â€� but they gave me a better one upstairs. The people at "reception" (aka a dutch door at the wall right near the front door) seemed nice enough, but spoke little English. The hotel is old, falling apart, depressing (despite pathetic attempt for cheeriness with a peeling purple and yellow paint job and dÃ©cor in the hallways) and has breakneck stairs (if you have problems with your knees or a lot of luggage, go elsewhere). The room I had was bare bones: bed, sink, mirror, bedside table, desk and TV. The sink and mirror were clean, but the cleanliness of rest of the room and the bed linens were questionable. Therefore, I slept on the comforter and the blanket I brought from home. Besides that, it took a good 20 minutes for the room to heat up (apparently, they had the heat off when people arenâ€™t there) after I arrived and sometimes quite cold during the night. Best of all, there was only one working electric outlet in the entire room which the bedside table lamp was plugged into (this consisted of an extension cord that disappeared into a hole in the wall). Now for the bathroom and showers: they were located down the hall in separate rooms, European style, but are a bit claustrophobic. I donâ€™t mind this, but again, it wasnâ€™t clear the last time they had been cleaned and two of them didnâ€™t have working locks. I was very happy that I had brought my flip-flops for the shower (also, be sure to bring towels, they do not supply them). Finally, one of the shower and toilet rooms are only separated by a partial wall (a 2-3 inch gap from the ceiling). Therefore, if you are in the shower and another person is doing some business on the toilet, you can hear and smell everything. Worst of all, if you are in the shower and not aware of this â€œgapâ€� between the two rooms, you might fear that someone is standing outside the shower curtain and is about to reenact the famous shower scene from Psycho with you staring as the victim. Overall, I wasn't impressed by Hotel Eureka and would most likely gone elsewhere if it wasn't New Year's weekend. However, it was only for two days and didn't ruin my stay in Montreal which is a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Never”
Reviews.Author: LsaKenducky
Reviews.Content: Do not ever stay here, Pls!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is terrible!

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: jihad r
Reviews.Content: i am writing to let you know that ELEGANT hotel was the worst hotel i have ever seen in my life i don't know where to start from at reception their was to ugly guys waiting for us they look really bad and the rooms was to small,bad looking and smells really bad very very old building and you can't call it a hotel or even a motel oh sorry not even bed and breakfast that's why we booked to another hotel and we didn't get our money back bad management bad environment bad in every thing?!?!?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location makes it worth it”
Reviews.Author: hshu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a short 5 minute walk from St. Catherine St which is the heart of downtown. Other hotels on the street go from $100-500 a night so this little hotel is a steal for $50 a night. The room is decent as in it's clean and has a big bed, shower, sink, tv and night stand. Your sink is in the bedroom which is comical and the only real drawback is the shared toilet down the hall from your room. I'm sure other upgraded rooms have their own toilet. This hotel doesn't like to keep the heat on so pack warm pajamas or remind them like we had to. Also we did not get towels so pack those! This is not a family friendly or romantic hotel- it's more suitable for those coming to party or those who are not bothered by the lack of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “If you read this review and still book this hotel, there's something wrong with you.”
Reviews.Author: ethanm1011
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I decided to get away last weekend and headed up to Montreal for a weekend full of drinking and hopefully relaxation. As college students, we aren't too particular about the quality of our hotels, which lead us to a one night stay in this Twenty-First Century tenement. First off, don't let the indication that this hotel is "downtown" deceive you. The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter and is AT LEAST a 30 minute walk from anywhere that you want to go in Montreal. When we arrived outside, we recognized that the area was far from ideal, but we were still optimistic. We entered through the front door and found ourselves seemingly trapped in a small room, enveloped by bars that were probably stolen from an old prison and nailed to the walls, where we were greeted by the man who was presumably the owner. Our encounter with this unmistakably shady individual was a much less than auspicious beginning to our stay. If you think you're going to get a rate that even remotely resembles the rates listed on the internet, think again; we paid $135 for a room with one double bed and two "mattresses" (actually two small, filthy pieces of textile from 1973 sewn together and stuffed with a centimetre of cotton). In addition to this, the guy asked me for $5 when i requested the WIFI password. I'm not sure he decided on either of these rates until we reached the window. The smell of the hallway (and rooms alike), which was similar to that of a dead animal smoking a cigarette, was amplified by the stifling heat that kept us awake all night (though the stench of our sweat did mitigate the smell a bit). The shared downstairs bathroom was comprised of nothing but an ineffective, barely usable lock and a toilet over which a small window conspicously sat despite being completely painted over with the same paint that was used to paint the rest of the diminutive bathroom around the time of the Watergate scandal. The only slight positive of the entire experience was that the shower, though on a different floor and shared, was relatively new (by relatively I mean that it was the only part of the hotel that's been rennovated since the fall of the Soviet Union). Needless to say, we booked a new hotel the following morning after we all combined for about three hours of sleep. The next hotel was considerably cheaper, cleaner, and the staff was much more congenial.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Eu-reek-a”
Reviews.Author: Clarinda76
Reviews.Content: To echo all of the other reviews for this hole - its the worst hotel I've ever checked into. After finding it on Budgetplaces.com I booked it as the photos, list of facitilites and reviews on there suggested it was no frills, but clean and convenient. We had booked 4 nights, and had to pay up front. Just as I finished handing over the cash someone in a room down the corridor began a very loud impersonation of the Meg Ryan restaurant scene in 'When Harry Met Sally'. I asked the receptionist if that was usual, and he just shrugged. The room was neat, but very shoddy and smelled unclean, like dirty sheets. The shared bathroom and toilet were vile. I asked to be moved to a room with a private bathroom, but was told unconvincingly that they were not available. The description I had booked with on the website indicated that we would have a private bathroom, but that it was not ensuite. Neither was wifi available. Both my parter and I felt very unsafe and physically sick being in the room, and spent just 20 mins walking around Montreal before we decided to return, collect our belongings, and check out. Amazingly, the receptionist seemed surprised that we were unhappy with the standard, and did not deny that the hotel is used by prostitutes. We lost our money, but felt much happier checking into the delightful Auberge Pomerol just as few steps away. We were even given a standard room for the price of an economy room. It really made up for a very shaky start to our visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “People! Do not stay there! It's a real HELL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anaida_10
Reviews.Content: Hades or Gehenna, call how you like. but until now it's like nighmare for me which I'm uncessfully trying to erase from my memory. The worst days in my life!!1The staff are swindlers and extortioners trying to squeeze money using every opportunity. If your life and health have any value for you never even look at that hotel from the distance!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Eureka? Should be called Hotel Urethra”
Reviews.Author: danamiele
Reviews.Content: Look, I am not a person that asks for much. I really don't. I don't ask for clean sheets, or a shower, or even running water, but this was truely the worst place I had ever been. As we enter a horrible part of town, violent and rough the person at the front desk tries to charge us double for what we were supossed to pay. He spoke english when we agreed with him, and pretended he wasnt fluent when we were trying to negotiate back to the original terms. He yelled and was rude. After a few hours of brutal yelling I decided to pay close to 100.00 for one night. When we went to our room someone else was in it. Then by the time 3 am rolled around there was one bed covered with insects and it smelt like urine intercourse and cocaine. I slept on my clothes and left those clothes there. The whole night police were outside the hotel and death threats being uttered around the window. We left in the morning. They said they were going to give us some of the money back, they didn't. And when we left, another man at the front desk, got even more mad and started yelling at us for no reason in particular. DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU HAVE ANY SELF WORTH.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN TOWN”
Reviews.Author: SUNMOON-11
Reviews.Content: I don't think that even this would be a shelter for homeless people. \my husband and \i went for honeymoon. \our b&b was cancelled a week before we were leaving Calgary so he was encharged to do the booking. Our story began in Eureka supposed to be two stars. I won't even give one. \the owner a \middle east man very grumpy the worst customer service. \no private washroom, toilet you have to share with a lot of people. Mouse trap undernead the beds stinky beds mattress full of wholes because of the mice. Trip advisor should wiped out of this site. It's a ripped of. If you looking for a bargain do not stay here is not worth the money and scarry people. No towels toilet paper, no bed sheets changed. Filty beds and pillows GandP

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Tuska31
Reviews.Content: I have booked my accomodation with hotel Eureka a month in advance as I like to have my trips planned in advance. 3 days stay in Montreal was supposed to be perfect finish of our Canada trip. Me and my husband have both been backpackers for many years so as long as place it's clean and reception person nice we are happy. We have got to the hotel and have been informed there that the room is more expensive than on our booking. We were also told in extremly rude manner that we need to pay cash and in advance - no refunds. We were tired so we agreed to the conditions, but then we have been informed that the room isn't ready all in very abusive manner. I have lost my patience and left the place, and the owner was laughing at us saying that I won't find anything else as it's long weekend. Few minutes later - thanks to the help of Rula -lovely reception lady at the Hotel Bon Accueil on St Huberst street we had clean accomodation for the competetive price. Don't ruin your Montreal experience by choosing this place - the bed bugs are not souvenirs you want to bring home.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in your van, it'll be more relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: RoseOfMexico
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I had the experience of staying here for 1 night, simply because my friend & I were stuck with nowhere to stay. The staff was pleasant enough, but they do not speak english at all. As others have mentioned, they could not find our reservation, and then when they did, (the boss on the phone) was annoyed at the price that we booked at. (No idea what that was about! We booked at $70 for the nite, believe me, I cannot IMAGINE how they could possibly ask for more than that for this place!) The room is small: simple bed, no tv, no screens on the open window, very dusty ceiling fan, and 1 bathroom on the floor with no sink in it (sink in your room.) This was a very SAD looking place, probably best saved for crack-heads. (I hate to say that, but there's no way even a budget traveller could justify staying at this place.) Oh, and did I mention that the bed was so uncomfortable that I couldn't sleep? In short, I'm not kidding.... if you can, sleep in your car - do so, before staying here. You don't want to shower in here anyway.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again - shouldn't have stayed in the first place”
Reviews.Author: Adamo_Poeta
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the main site a week before arrival and as I was traveling on budget I figured ok, $55 per night for 2 nights, great location - let's see can't be that bad. Well, upon arrival they could not find my reservation - apparently they never got the confirmation from their main site! Partially my fault for not calling to check prior I suppose. As it was already Friday afternoon and opening of Jazz Festival I was worried other places are booked too and besides I was running late for the conference so a decision had to be made quick. They offered me their standard price of 70$ per night which I refused - eventually lowering it to 60$ which I agreed to. When I came back to check in after the conference later in the night I got to see the room: tiny, claustrophobic, run-down, no bathroom, small sketchy sink, barely room for a slanted bed, no screen on the windows so if you want to leave the window open good luck with flies and mosquitoes. There is a tv thank god to catch up on news and World Cup, but no phone and their internet was down the whole weekend - luckily I was able to catch a different free connection provided by a nearby location. The first night as I was eating my dinner in bed a crustacean bug fell off the ceiling (instantly killing my appetite and causing a worry what else might fall on me throughout the night). More on bugs: the next day I spotted and killed a big black spider crawling on the wall (maybe I should have let it live to catch bugs but again how will I know it won't crawl on my face at night), and upon my return home I noticed small red spots on my hands and arms in clusters of 2 and 3 - presumably bites of some kind. I made sure to keep my bag and backpack on the door hooks the whole stay in fear of bedbugs so hopefully I did not bring anything home with me (fingers crossed). By the way, when I checked in I saw the receipt said no refund: not a good sign! Lesson learned here: there is travel on budget for when you just need a bed and bathroom in a clean establishment (what I was looking for) and then there is staying in run down places fearing bugs with communal shower and bathrooms.... Hotel Eureka offered the latter.

Reviews.Title: “hookers and crack heads”
Reviews.Author: tropicalvagabond
Reviews.Content: you know its going to be bad when the manager tells you NO REFUND as soon as he gets the cash in hand, but then it gets worse. all night a steady stream of drug addicts and prostitutes stumble through the narrow hallways, have sex in the shared shower and fight over change in the rooms. though the manager says they only RENT ROOMS BY THE HOUR on the first floor the addicts and sex workers seem to have the run of the place. You got to wonder why the provincial tourism agency allows this place to use its logo and name to promote itself. STAY CLEAR or you will regret visiting Montreal

Reviews.Title: “cheap, but still it does not pay its price..”
Reviews.Author: ljad15
Reviews.Content: The carpet and closet were stinking of pee, the basin was very dirty (my guess is that previous guests had peed in the basin, dropping all around..). Only the ceiling light was working. The location is nice, but extremely noisy. They advertised the availabilty of fridge and microwave, actually the receptionists has them, but kindly allows you to use them. The price did not match those at which I had booked the room, the explanation the receptionist gave me no explanation. The advantage is that you can have a single room at a little price, now I think it would be worth it to pay a bit more for both beds in a double room of another hotel/hostel.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER - IT HAD BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: roadtripping8
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively in the last year and this was my worst hotel/hostel experience so far. The room looked okay until I woke up in the morning itching and looked down to find a bed crawling with bed bugs! We tried to tell the person at the front desk whom I am assuming first language was French but they didn't seem to understand. Also, we didn't feel entriely safe in the neighbourhood/block it is located in. All night you could here ppl. from the bar below yelled at one other, and a few fights.

Reviews.Title: “hahaha never ever stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: UmbrellaRed
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is being written from the actual hotel! I felt so disgusted at the place that I have wasted no time in reviewing it. Our basic one bed room = exactly that - smells, no tv, no towels, no lamp ( just one shady twist on-off light in ceiling) there is soap thankfully, but the horrible washroom down the hall is out of toilet paper and dirty and gross. Upstairs is a small and offputting shared shower, have not committed to experiencing it yet. There are shady people going down the narrow hallway constantly, they are loud and definantly up to no good. Families with noisy rude kids seem to live here too. Not a secure room as the window does not lock and it faces the street, just about head height at street level. Stay far, far away from this dirty, dodgy, stained floor hotel! Wish we read the reviews before we booked - wont make that mistake again!

Reviews.Title: “Badest Hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Monteiro
Reviews.Content: I aboslutely agree to the others reviewer. Wost hotel I ever stayed. My reservation got lost and it took me over 40min to chek-in. had to log in at the reception computer to print out my reservation. and there I've seen why my reservation got lost. lots of papers an list and just crap all over. The hole "hotel" smelled after campher ast you know it from mothballs. And in the room there was a bad smell of cirgarette smoke too. The rooms (had to change it after one night!) were so small, I didn't really know where to place my luggage. The curtains were to short, so that sun and nightlight just sined on my head! The towels and sheet dind look very clean and they havn't been replaced at anytime during my stay. The same with the rooms in general and the showers. In the nights ist very noisy, because of the bad windows and the busy street. The only positive thig is that this hotel is next to the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “STILL a very crappy place indeed”
Reviews.Author: Swisstime
Reviews.Content: Well, all I can say is that I really wish I had read all the reviews here before booking a room at this place at HostelBookers. First, lets get to the good. Don't worry though cause this won't take long. The only good thing I can thing about this place is that it is located very close tto the Berri-UQAM subway station (the subway intersection station of three lines). This made getting around the city very easy. NOW, for the BAD... The people are right, there are lot of shady characters around the place. I saw drug deals going down multiple times, people running at the sight and sound of police cars, gambling, and a lot of bums hocking loogies left, right and centre. Also, during the weekend there is an excessive amount of noise because of the bar directly below this place (which also invites a lot scary, unwelcoming individuals). Believe it or not, the actual insides of the hotel are just as putrid as the outside. The showers are extremely claustrophobic, and when located in the rooms, are guaranteed not to open fully. The sink is located in a tiny nook in the room with no covering door or curtain. The public showers are filthy. The sheets and towels aren't replaced on a daily basis. There are no phones in the rooms. The TV sucks and takes up way too much of the already limited space in the rooms. There are mice (I never saw one, but I suspect it's true after I saw little nibbles in my cookie and its packet). The beds are mighty uncomfortable. The staff are kinda shady. The fan really does feel like its going to fall off it hinge and come crashing down on you. On my last day, there was no hot water available for the showers. There are no clocks in the room. You feel like your gonna fall walking up and down the narrow stairway. Now believe you me, all of these things are true. I have mixed reactions about this trip because while Montreal is an amazing and friendly place to be, I feel my stay at this place made my time in Montreal uncomfortable. I really wish I had read these reviews before being suckered into this place. I only wish for two things now that I have returned home....that 1) YOU do not stay at this place 2) and that this place is CLOSED down and the surrounding area cleaned up That being said, I hope I have shed some insight into this place and hope you will enjoy your stay elsewhere in Montreal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place ive ever seen”
Reviews.Author: nplv18
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest hotel ive ever seen, and im not a picky person by anymeans. Drug addicts all over the place and prostitutes all over. i was asked to buy drugs before i even checked in. the staff is in on the stuff goin on in side as i saw them goin in and out of rooms at all hours. you share a bathroom and shower, its just gross. the staff was incredable rude wouldnt even let u finish a sentene without inturupting. tried to charge five dollars for an extra key. the rooms were filthy cigarette stains all over the sing, no phone tv didnt work, the beds were 2 inches apart no space to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest experience”
Reviews.Author: funnychap24
Reviews.Content: Using Orbitz in June, I made our reservation for the end of July. My credit card was immediately charged one night by the hotel. I found that strange and figured out what happened as I checked into the hotel. The employee named Johnny and I figured out that the hotel mistakenly assumed my reservation was for June. They assumed we were a no-show. Thus, they charged me that night. Luckily I had printed out a copy of the orbitz reservation as that was the only proof I had that the hotel made the mistake! Johnny printed out a receipt and explained that at that moment of our actual check-in, I would be refunded the money wrongly charged in June and would be charged the entire amount of our stay. I finally got my refund for that incorrect initial charge--only after I filed a claim with my credit card company and emailed the hotel saying it was long after my stay and I never was given the refund to which I was entitled. It proved worth it to keep the paper trail! I didn't think the hotel was in the worst area. I felt it was safe at night to walk around. It was just very noisy! The Berri-Uqam subway stop was a convenient few steps away. (You can easily cut through the Couche-Tard mini-mart located very close to the hotel) Our room was cramped. Barely enough room between the beds and anything nearby. The whimpy ceiling fan was more a noise nuisance and didn't cool us off at all. And the room temperature climbed very high on the hot summer nights! The one small window could be opened but there was barely any breeze and the noise from the streets below would wake the dead--especially on a weekend! The shared bathrooms were always unoccupied when needed. Footwear (flip flops, etc.) highly recommended while showering. Neither the towels nor the linens were changed at all during the few days of our stay. The linen closet across from our room was left opened/unlocked for the first two days of our stay so we thought we were supposed to help ourselves--and that we did. Would I stay here again? Maybe. If I did though, I would bring a big fan or three in the back of our car so we could be cooled off at night. And most importantly, I would again make the reservation via something like Orbitz for the visible fact that their records don't seem to be well-organized. I mean...imagine if we arrived and there were no rooms for us since they had incorrectly assumed our stay was for June. See my pictures and make sure you're prepared to sacrifice some comfort--since you're most likely trying to save money by staying here (like us).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...Not bad at all.”
Reviews.Author: veata
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eureka is not in the safest part of Montreal but it is in a very convenient location. My friend and I stayed in Hotel Eureka for 3 nights and we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go (shopping, food, bus, cafÃ©, club), and no taxi was needed. Upon entering the Hotel, the scene is quite like a small town house with many, very steep narrow steps (so if youâ€™re not into climbing stairs, maybe this isnâ€™t the best place). The receptionist guy was really nice, we were late for check in and he didnâ€™t get upset. He gave us our keys and walked us to our room. The room itself was SO SMALL! But, for the price we paid it was fine. We had our own shower and sink and the toilette was down the hall. The shower was so clean; in fact, the entire room was very clean upon arrival. The toilette down the hall was cleaned a few times a day so it never smelt bad or had someone elseâ€™s â€œleavingsâ€� in there. They do not come into your room during the day and make the bed for you or anything, they donâ€™t even give fresh towels, but Iâ€™m sure if you asked they would give. The noise level inside the hotel was quiet during night hours but it was a bit on the noisy side outside of the hotel and from our room we could hear it all. Iâ€™m a clean freak so I was a little apprehensive about going to a lower end hotel, but this place was clean, small but clean. I would definitely book a room in Hotel Eureka again!

Reviews.Title: “European flare”
Reviews.Author: jonstebow
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the airport in Montreal late at night, the hotel is quite the economy hotel and therefore has no airport shuttle. It is a flat rate of $35 for a taxi to downtown Montreal. The hotel has a great location, it is right across the road from an entrance to the underground and Metro entrance. To enter the hotel, you need to ring a buzzer for someone to let you in 24 hours a day (24 hour security). We did have some problems checking in on the first night, because their credit card machine could not connect. After trying for about a half hour, they told me I could pay tomorrow. Upon entering the room, I noticed that there was only a sink, a bed, and a tv that got one english channel. However, everything was very clean, and there were two toilets and two showers in the hallway. My girlfriend loved it and would return in a heartbeat, I personally would rather a hotel with my own shower and toilet. If you are looking for a place to simply sleep and are on a tight budget, this is the place for you. If you enjoy any amenities at all, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “THE Worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel Eureka last year in June for the Montreal Grand-Prix. I didnt expect much from the hotel because i already knew that it was in a somewhat bad neighborhood. Upon arrival, I saw 2 prostitues walk in. The service was terrible, tried charging more than they said over the phone. Doors were rickety and the locks we terrible( someone could easily break in your room. That night was the worst night ever in a hotel, it was 85 degrees inside, no A/C,a broken tv, loud yelling from a bar outside, and prostitues coming and going all the while. I would not suggest this hotel to anyone, even if they were broke and out of money.

Reviews.Title: “It was the worst hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rate for the hotel changes depending on what the office feels they can get form u. They offered a special savings if we paid cash and when we did there was no differance. The room were very small and good luck tring to get clean towels the next day (forget about having the room changed over). I was never so hot in my life in a room. I could open the window and hear the singing from the bar below to 4:00 am in the morning or close it and bake in the room. Fan works that was the only thing but was not good to cool off the room. No clock, radio, or phone but there is a tv but it doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Shady place, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The area in which the hotel is located in is very dirty, with a lot of weirdos roaming around. The hotel itself (unlike any I have visited) locks its front door at all times. They have a camera to screen its visitors and unlock the door with the buzzer. No parking is available for visitors and closest â€œpublicâ€� parking is $15 per day. Had we known about the parking fee (which brings the price/night to $97 incl. tax) we could have stayed at a hotel rated much higher and in a much better neighborhood. Our room was very small (despite the fact we took one of the larger and more expensive ones), no a/c, tv with 3 working channels and very thin walls. People are arriving at all times of the day or night and it gets noisy even after 1-2 in the morning. We barely got any sleep during the weekend. Toilets are shared and there are 3 for the entire floor with 8-10 rooms. I had to wait to use them on several occasions. The service was poor, rooms very not cleaned although we stayed for two nights and no fresh towels were offered. On top of it all, the management has found us guilty of breaking a shower door and without notifying me has proceeded to charge my credit card $103.50 allegedly for work required. No invoice or any explanation was given except â€œyou broke the doorâ€� and my repeated calls were not answered. I am currently considering legal action against the hotel. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COST.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGrrlNY
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience I've had at any hotel. First, the proprieter gave us a hard time even though we had reserved ahead of time - we had reserved a room with 2 double beds and he was giving us a room with only 1. Then he tried to charge a higher price than what we had reserved for. Then he wouldn't take our credit cards and wanted cash -- it was troublesome since we didn't have enough on us to cover the stay. We requested paying at checkout and he refused. Our room was ridiculously small. They had taken a room for a single double bed and crammed 2 beds into it. Because of this there was no other furniture in the room except for a TV that didn't work and no space to walk or put our things. There was no closet or drawers and the towels were on the radiator because there was no other place for them. The bathroom was in the hallway, which we knew ahead of time. There was no A/C in the room so it was very hot and stuffy at night, despite a ceiling fan. I was more disappointed in the service than the room and that was what made it a bad experience. If the hotel manager had been nicer and not tried to cheat us it would have been a much better experience.
